para: When solving nonlinear equations with 's method, &oof2; needs to know the derivatives of some of the material &properties; with respect to the &field; values. If the &properties; don't provide code that evaluates the derivatives, &oof2; can still use 's method by evaluating the derivatives numerically. epsilon sets the size of the perturbation, relative to the &field; value, that is applied to the &field; values when differentiating the &property;.
The default value of the relative perturbation is 10-5. An absolute perturbation less than 16 times the double precision machine epsilon will never be used.
In the GUI, this command is invoked from the Settings menu in the main &oof2; window's menubar.
